Key Match Events: Bukayo Saka scored a stunner from outside the box to keep England alive in the game.
Breel Embolo scored off a low cross to give Switzerland the advantage.
Trent Alexander Arnold scored the winning penalty to decide the game in favor of England.
England scored all of their spot-kicks to beat Switzerland 5-3 in penalties to make their way into the Euro 2024 semi-finals.
Pre-Game Insights: England manager Gareth Southgate had sounded confident that his team would turn the page in the quarter-final.
Switzerland, who were expected to be the more attacking team of the two in the opening minutes, had their share of chances but were unable to carve anything promising.
Post-Match Reflections: Bukayo Saka said, 'I am going to put it there with the best nights for England. It was special with how we fought back. I am proud of everyone.'
Trent Alexander Arnold said, 'It shows how much we want to win the tournament. In the past two games we have gone down and come back. Hopefully we can win the next game in 90 minutes.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game went into extra time as neither team could score in the 90 minutes.
The Swiss attack down the left and the ball's crossed towards Embolo at the far post, but it's headed clear by Luke Shaw.
England have flicked their attacking switch in the last few minutes.
Jude Bellingham has a go from outside the Swiss box and it whiskers past the crossbar.
